available_tools.name: Ticket ParserAgent
available_tools.description: Given a ticket ID: 1. Retrieve the raw ticket content using search_documentation 2. Parse the ticket to extract key information.

parameters.name: ticketID
parameters.description: The ID of the ticket to be parsed. This ID is used to retrieve the raw ticket content from the documentation system.

return.description: Ticket's key information extracted from the raw content, including Severity level, AWS account IDs, AWS region, Error messages, Affected services, Timeline information, Stakeholders

available_tools.name: Issue Classifier Agent
available_tools.description: categorize and classify incidents based on ticket data

parameters.name: parsedTicket
parameters.description: Parsed ticket information containing key details such as severity, AWS account IDs, region, error messages, affected services, timeline, and stakeholders.

return.description: Structured classification of the incident including Issue category (e.g., availability, performance, security), Service domain (e.g., compute, storage, networking), Priority level, Impact scope, and Patterns of issue types.

available_tools.name: Service Attribution Agent
available_tools.description: Identify AWS services involved in an incident based on ticket and classification data.

parameters.name: ticketData
parameters.description: Ticket data containing key information such as severity, AWS account IDs, region, error messages, affected services, timeline, and stakeholders.

parameters.name: classificationData
parameters.description: Classification data containing structured information about the incident including issue category, service domain, priority level, impact scope, and patterns of issue types.

return.description: Comprehensive service attribution data that maps the incident to specific AWS services and components, including service names, metadata, documentation URLs, pipeline URLs, package names, dependencies, and relationships.

available_tools.name: CloudWatch Agent
available_tools.description: Analyze CloudWatch logs related to an incident.

parameters.name: awsAccount
parameters.description: The AWS account ID where the incident occurred.

parameters.name: awsRegion
parameters.description: The AWS region where the incident occurred.

parameters.name: awsService
parameters.description: The AWS service related to the incident (e.g., EC2, S3, Lambda).

return.description: Detailed analysis of CloudWatch logs that provides evidence about what happened during the incident, including log group retrieval, error pattern searches, anomaly detection, unique error templates extraction, error aggregation, log correlation across services, normal behavior comparison, alarm status checks, and event timeline creation.

available_tools.name: Code Analyzer Agent
available_tools.description: Analyze code repositories related to affected services.

parameters.name: serviceAttributionData
parameters.description: Service attribution data containing package names, repository information, and details about affected services.

return.description: Comprehensive code analysis that identifies potential code-level causes for the incident, including error patterns, configuration files, recent code changes, deployment artifacts, code structure and dependencies, configuration settings, and potential code-related issues.

available_tools.name: Root Cause Analyzer Agent
available_tools.description: Synthesize all available information to determine the root cause of the incident.

parameters.name: timeline
parameters.description: Comprehensive timeline of the incident, including key events, timestamps, and descriptions of actions taken.

parameters.name: businessImpact
parameters.description: Assessment of the business impact of the incident, including affected services, customers, and financial implications.

parameters.name: rootCauseAnalysis
parameters.description: Root cause analysis methodologies applied to the incident, including 5 Whys analysis, contributing factors identification, evidence evaluation, and likelihood assessment of different potential causes.

parameters.name: primaryRootCause
parameters.description: The primary root cause identified through the analysis.

parameters.name: supportingEvidence
parameters.description: Supporting evidence collected during the analysis, including logs, code snippets, configuration files, and any other relevant data.

parameters.name: recommendations
parameters.description: Recommendations for immediate and long-term fixes to prevent recurrence of the incident.

parameters.name: stakeholders
parameters.description: List of stakeholders involved in the incident response and analysis, including their roles and responsibilities.

return.description: Detailed root cause analysis with evidence-based conclusions and actionable recommendations, including a comprehensive timeline of the incident, business impact assessment, root cause analysis methodologies applied, primary root cause identified, supporting evidence documented, and recommendations for immediate and long-term fixes.

available_tools.name: Report Generator Agent
available_tools.description: Generate a comprehensive Root Cause Analysis (RCA) report based on the analysis from all previous agents.

parameters.name: incidentAnalysis
parameters.description: Complete analysis from all previous agents, including executive summary, incident overview, timeline of events, impact assessment, technical details, root cause analysis, resolution steps, action items, and lessons learned.

return.description: Well-formatted, comprehensive Root Cause Analysis (RCA) report that clearly communicates what happened, why it happened, and how to prevent it in the future. The report includes an executive summary, structured incident overview, formatted timeline of events, impact assessment, technical details including CloudWatch findings, root cause analysis, resolution steps, action items with priorities, lessons learned, and relevant appendices with supporting data.
